def: A term applied to the bark obtained from young oak trees.McElrath.

Pertaining to, or resembling, a family of endogenous and mostlyepiphytic or saxicolous plants of which the genera Tillandsia andBillbergia are examples. The pineapple, though terrestrial, is alsoof this family.
The act of talking in one's sleep; somniloquism.
To raise captious and frivolous objections; to find faultwithout good reason.You do not well in obstinacy To cavil in the course of this contract.Shak.
To plow. [Obs.] See Ear, v. t. Chaucer.

The alphabet; -- formerly so called, either from the crossusually set before it, or from a superstitious custom, sometimespracticed, of writing it in the form of a cross, by way of a charm.From infant conning of the Christcross-row. Wordsworth.
Capable of being vitrified, or converted into glass by heat andfusion; as, flint and alkalies are vitrifiable.
Incapacity of being engendered or produced. Cudworth.
